original: Assarson, Per Åke, stadsläkare, Karlshamn, f. 25/1/94 i Riseberga, Krist. 1., av disp. Nils August A. o. Carolina Andersson. G. 25 m. Kerstin Tengvall. Barn: Birgit f. 26, Hedvig Margareta 30, Per Axel 34, Nils Ake 39. — Stud:ex. 12, med. kand. 18 o. med. lic. 24, allt i Lund. Marinläk:-stip. över stat 20-22, i res. 23, marin-läk. av andra gr. v. Mlk 28-29, i res. 29. Assist :läk. v. Karlshamns las. 24-25, und :läk. där 25-26 samt förste und:läk. 26-28, e. asisist. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. röntgenavd. 25, tf. andre stads-läk. i Karlshamn und. vakans 29, tf. förste stadsläk. 30-38, stadsläk. i Karlshamn sed. 38, tf. prov:läk. i Karlshamns diistr. två mån. 31, läk. v. Stampaholms o. Ekhagens anst. f. sinnesslöa 33, v. epid:sjukh. i Karlshamn sed. 30, v. samrealsk., folksk. samt SJ 29. Insp. f. Karlshamns samrealsk. 35. Hobbies: tennis, jakt.
translated: Assarson, Per Åke, city doctor, Karlshamn, born January 25, 1894 in Riseberga, Krist. 1., son of Nils August A. and Carolina Andersson. Married to Kerstin Tengvall with children Birgit born in 1926, Hedvig Margareta in 1930, Per Axel in 1934, and Nils Ake in 1939. He completed his studies with a degree from Lund in 1912, medical candidate in 1918, and medical license in 1924. He received a marine medical scholarship over state from 1920-1922, was in residence in 1923, a marine doctor in the second degree from 1928-1929, an assistant doctor at Karlshamns Hospital from 1924-1925, an understudy doctor there from 1925-1926 and first understudy doctor from 1926-1928. He was a substitute at Sabbatsberg Hospital's radiology department in 1925, temporary second city doctor in Karlshamn during vacancy in 1929, temporary first city doctor from 1930-1938, and has been the city doctor of Karlshamn since 1938. He was also a temporary medical inspector for Karlshamn's district for two months in 1931, physician at Stampaholm and Ekhagen's institution for the mentally disabled in 1933, at the epidemic hospital in Karlshamn since 1930, and at secondary school, primary school, and Swedish Railways in 1929. He was an inspector for Karlshamn's secondary school in 1935. His hobbies include tennis and hunting.

award.name: Marine Medical Scholarship
award.description: Awarded scholarship for clinical research in marine medicine
